item.description:
üéØ Overview

Unlike file permissions which control access based on users and groups, file attributes provide system-level protection that even applies to root users. Let‚Äôs explore how to use chattr and lsattr to manage these powerful file attributes.

üîç What are chattr and lsattr?

chattr (Change Attribute)

A Linux command used to change file system attributes.

These attributes can protect files from modification or deletion, even by root users.

lsattr (List Attribute)

A command to display the special attributes of files in Linux file systems.
